ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:0.5_0: 6. The second training rule on the same sleeping place
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.2_0: One evening as Venerable Anuruddha was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī, he arrived at a certain village.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.3_0: Just then a woman in that village had prepared her guesthouse.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.4_0: Then Venerable Anuruddha went to her.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.4_1: He then said to her, “Sister, if it’s troublesome for you, we’d like to stay in your guesthouse for one night.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.6_0: Other travelers also approached that woman.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.6_1: She said to her, “Madam, if it’s not troublesome for you, we’d like to stay in your guesthouse for one night.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.7_0: “Sirs, an ascetic is already staying there. If he agrees, you may stay.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.8_1: “If it’s convenient for you, Venerable, we’d like to stay for one night in your guesthouse.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.10_0: Now as soon as that woman had seen Anuruddha, she had fallen in love with him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.11_1: She said to him, “Sir, you won’t be at ease surrounded by these people.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.12_0: It would be good if I prepared a bed for you in the main house.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.14_0: After preparing a bed in the main house, she put on jewelery and perfume, and she approached Anuruddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.16_0: It would be good, Sir, if I were to become your wife.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.19_0: And a third time she said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.21_0: It would be good, Sir, if you took me and all this property.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.23_0: She then threw off her wrap, and she walked up and down, stood, sat down, and lay down in front of him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.24_0: But Anuruddha controlled his senses and neither looked at nor spoke to her.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.25_0: Then that woman said, “It’s astonishing and amazing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.26_0: Many people send for me with a hundred or a thousand coins.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.27_0: But this ascetic, even when begged by me, doesn’t want me and all this property.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.28_0: After dressing, she bowed down with her head at Anuruddha’s feet and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.29_0: “Sir, I’ve committed an offense. Foolishly, deludedly, and unskillfully I acted like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.30_0: Please accept my confession for my future restraint.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.31_0: “Certainly you have committed an offense. Foolishly, deludedly, and unskillfully you acted like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.32_0: But since you have recognized your mistake for what it is, and have dealt with it properly, I accept it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.33_0: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones, that is, acknowledging an offense, making amends in accordance with the Teaching, and undertaking restraint for the future.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.34_0: The following morning that woman personally served and satisfied Anuruddha with various kinds of fine food. When he had finished his meal, she bowed and sat down to one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.35_0: And Anuruddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.38_0: Just as one might set upright what had been overturned, or reveal what had been hidden, or show the way to one who was lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.39_0: even so has Anuruddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.40_0: I go for refuge to the Buddha and to the Teaching and to the Sangha of monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.41_0: Please accept me as a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.42_0: Soon afterwards, after arriving at Sāvatthī, Anuruddha told the monks what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.43_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.44_0: “How can Venerable Anuruddha lay down in the same sleeping place as a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.45_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Anuruddha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.46_0: “Is it true, Anuruddha, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.48_0: The Buddha rebuked him ... “Anuruddha, how can you lay down in the same sleeping place as a woman?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.49_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.50_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:1.51.1_0: ‘If a monk lay down in the same sleeping place as a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.6_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, all the more an older one.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.8_0: The Buddha then sat down together.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.10_0: It is mostly proper for allocated.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.13_0: if the monk lies down when the woman is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.14_0: if the woman lies down when the monk is already lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.15_0: If both lie down together, they commit an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.1.16_0: Every time they get up and then lie down again, they commit an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.1_0: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he lays down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.2_0: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he lays down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.3_0: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he lays down in the same sleeping place as her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.4_0: If he cuts half the size of his bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.5_0: If he lays down in the same sleeping place as a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a _paṇḍaka_, or with a female animal in the form of a woman, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.6_0: If it is not a woman, but he perceives her as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.7_0: If it is not a home, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.2.8_0: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.6_0: if the monk sits when the woman is lying down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.7_0: if the woman sits when the monk is lying down;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.8_0: if they both sit down together;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc6:2.3.11_0: The sixth rule, the second training rule on a thousand coins, is finished.
